meanings.definition: Having or showing good sense or judgment.
meanings.sent1: She made a sensibler choice by studying for the test instead of going out with friends.
meanings.sent2: It is sensibler to wear a helmet while riding a bike to protect your head.
meanings.sent3: The sensibler option would be to bring an umbrella in case it rains during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: His sensibler approach to problem-solving always leads to effective solutions.
meanings.sent5: The sensibler decision to save money for the future paid off when an unexpected expense arose.

meanings.sent1: The sensibler cat could sense the approaching storm before anyone else.
meanings.sent2: As a sensibler individual, she could empathize with others' emotions easily.
meanings.sent3: The sensibler puppy wagged its tail happily when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: Her sensibler intuition warned her not to trust the stranger's offer.
meanings.sent5: The sensibler child could detect the subtle changes in his mother's tone of voice.
